U: S. Secretary of Health and Human Services Kathleen Sebelius stated in a speech that some Georgians can get a health insurance plan for as low as $105 a month.
The information was verified on HealthCa: gov, which confirmed that under the Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act, such premiums do exist.
A specific example was provided: stating that a 27-year-old living in Cobb County and making $25,000 a year can qualify for the lowest bronze plan with $105-a-month premiums.
The U: S. Department of Health and Human Services provided data showing the range of available plans in Georgia, with premiums as low as $142 a month for catastrophic coverage and $179 a month for the lowest bronze plan.
